titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C16

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

body.ab:
<lb n="c56-0119__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0119.01" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 14<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0119__main__2"/>The
next day, contrary
to
the
prognostics
of
our
<lb n="c56-0119__main__3"/>
guides,
was
fine
although clouded.
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>We
visited
the
<lb n="c56-0119__main__4"/>
source
of
the
Aveiron
and
rode about the
<lb n="c56-0119__main__5"/>
valley
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21836__Start"/>the whole da<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21836__End"/>until evening.
These sublime and
<lb n="c56-0119__main__6"/>
magnificent scenes afforded me the greatest
<lb n="c56-0119__main__7"/>
consolation that I was capable of
receiving <lb n="c56-0119__main__8"/>
They elevated me from all littleness of
feeling <lb n="c56-0119__main__9"/>
and although they
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21855__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21855__End"/>
did not remove my
<lb n="c56-0119__main__10"/> grief
they
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21860__Start"/>t<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21860__End"/>
subdued and
tranquilized
it.
<lb n="c56-0119__main__11"/>
In some degree,
also
they diverted my mind
<lb n="c56-0119__main__12"/>
from the thoughts
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>over
which it had brooded
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21881__Start"/>over<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21881__End"/><lb n="c56-0119__main__13"/>
for the last
month<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21887__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21887__End"/>.
I
returned in the
<lb n="c56-0119__main__14"/>
evening,
fatigued
but less
unhappy
and
convered <lb n="c56-0119__main__15"/>
with
the
family
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21894__Start"/>t<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21894__End"/>
with more cheerfulness than
<lb n="c56-0119__main__16"/><del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21898__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21898__End"/>
had been
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21904__Start"/>accustomed<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21904__End"/>my
custom for some time. My fa<lb n="c56-0119__main__17"/>ther was
pleased
and
Elizabeth
overjoyed; "My <lb n="c56-0119__main__18"/>
dear
Cousin,"
said she,
"You
see what happiness
<lb n="c56-0119__main__19"/>
you diffuse when you are
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21924__Start"/>cheerful<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21924__End"/>happy;
do
<lb n="c56-0119__main__20"/>
not relapse
again!—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0119__main__21"/>
The
following morning
the rain
poured
<lb n="c56-0119__main__22"/>
down
in
torrents
and thick mists hid
<lb n="c56-0119__main__23"/>
the summits of the
mountains. I rose
early <lb n="c56-0119__main__24"/>
but felt unusually melancholy.
The
rain
<lb n="c56-0119__main__25"/>
depressed
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me,
my old feelings
recurred <lb n="c56-0119__main__26"/>
and I was miserable.
I
knew how
my father
<lb n="c56-0119__main__27"/>
would
be
dissapointed
at this sudden
<lb n="c56-0119__main__28"/> change
and
I wished to avoid him
<lb n="c56-0119__main__29"/> untill
I had
<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21965__Start"/>rev<del loc="c56-0119__main__d1e21965__End"/>
recovered myself so far
<lb n="c56-0119__main__30"/>
as
to
conceal
the
feelings that overpowered
<lb n="c56-0119__main__31"/> me —
I knew that they would remain
<lb n="c56-0119__main__32"/>
that day at the
inn
and as I
had<lb n="c56-0120__main__1"/><del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e21980__Start"/>n<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e21980__End"/>ever
inured myself
to
rain
and
cold
I
<lb n="c56-0120__main__2"/>
resolved
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e21985__Start"/>t<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e21985__End"/>
to
go
to the summit of
<lb n="c56-0120__main__3"/> Montanvert <del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e21992__Start"/>by myself<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e21992__End"/>alone.
I remembered
<lb n="c56-0120__main__4"/>
the effect
the view of the tremendous
<lb n="c56-0120__main__5"/>
and
ever moving
glacier had
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22006__Start"/>had<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22006__End"/><lb n="c56-0120__left_margin__1"/>produced<lb n="c56-0120__main__6"/>
upon my mind when I first saw
it
<lb n="c56-0120__main__7"/><del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22023__Start"/>how<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22023__End"/>It
had then filled me with
<lb n="c56-0120__main__8"/>
a sublime
extacy
that gave wings
<lb n="c56-0120__main__9"/>
to the
soul
and allowed
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it
to soar from
<lb n="c56-0120__main__10"/>
the
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22052__Start"/>lower<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22052__End"/>obscure
world to light & joy. The
<lb n="c56-0120__main__11"/>
sight of the awful & majestic in
<lb n="c56-0120__main__12"/>
nature had indeed always the effect
<lb n="c56-0120__main__13"/>
of
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22068__Start"/>tranquillizing the<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22068__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>solemnizing<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>my mind
& causing
<lb n="c56-0120__main__14"/>
me to forget
the
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22088__Start"/>the<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22088__End"/> passing cares
<lb n="c56-0120__main__15"/>
of life. I determined to go
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22096__Start"/>by myself<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22096__End"/>alone<lb n="c56-0120__main__16"/>
for I was well acquainted with the
<lb n="c56-0120__main__17"/> path
and the presence of another
<lb n="c56-0120__main__18"/><del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22110__Start"/>had the effect of<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22110__End"/>would destroy<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22117__Start"/>ing<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22117__End"/>
the
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22121__Start"/>solitary<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22121__End"/><lb n="c56-0120__main__19"/>
solitary grandeur of the
scene.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0120__main__20"/> The
ascent
<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22133__Start"/>to the mountain<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22133__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>ispre<lb n="c56-0120__main__21"/>cipitous<metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22157__Start"/>with<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22157__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>but
the path is cut into continual and short
<lb n="c56-0120__main__22"/> windings
which
enable<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22173__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22173__End"/><del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22177__Start"/>to<del loc="c56-0120__main__d1e22177__End"/>
you
<lb n="c56-0120__main__23"/>
surmount the
perpedicularity
of
<lb n="c56-0120__main__24"/>
the
mountains–
It is a scene
terrifical <lb n="c56-0120__main__25"/> ly
desolate. In a thousand
places
the
<lb n="c56-0120__main__26"/>
traces of the winter
avelanche
may
<lb n="c56-0120__main__27"/>
be
perceived
where trees lie broken
<lb n="c56-0120__main__28"/>
and strewed on the ground; some
<lb n="c56-0120__main__29"/>
entirely
destroyed
others
bent
leaning<lb n="c56-0121__main__1"/> upon
<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22206__Start"/>juts in<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22206__End"/>
the jutting
<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22211__Start"/>corners<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22211__End"/>rocks
of the
<lb n="c56-0121__main__2"/>
mountain, or
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>transversely
upon other trees. The
<lb n="c56-0121__main__3"/> path
as you
<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22233__Start"/>ascen<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22233__End"/>
ascend
higher
is
inters<lb n="c56-0121__main__4"/><del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22241__Start"/>persed<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22241__End"/>ectedby
ravines of snow, down which
<lb n="c56-0121__main__5"/>
stones continually roll from above;
<lb n="c56-0121__main__6"/>
one of
the
them is particularly
dange<lb n="c56-0121__main__7"/>rous
as the slightest
sound
such as even<lb n="c56-0121__main__8"/> speaking in a loud
voice
produces a
suffi<lb n="c56-0121__main__9"/> cient
concussion of air sufficient
<lb n="c56-0121__main__10"/>
to draw destruction
the head of the
<lb n="c56-0121__main__11"/>
speaker. The pines
here
are not
<lb n="c56-0121__main__12"/>
tall or
luxuriant
but they are
sombre <lb n="c56-0121__main__13"/>
and add an air of
<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22305__Start"/>gravit<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22305__End"/>severity
to the scene.
<lb n="c56-0121__main__14"/>
I looked on the valley
beneath.;
Vast
mist <lb n="c56-0121__main__15"/>
were rising from the
river
which ran
<lb n="c56-0121__main__16"/> through<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22322__Start"/>t<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22322__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it
and curling in thick wreaths
<lb n="c56-0121__main__17"/>
around the opposite
mountains <lb n="c56-0121__main__18"/>
whose summits were hid in the <lb n="c56-0121__main__19"/><lb n="c56-0121__left_margin__1"/>uniform clouds, while rain poured from the
<lb n="c56-0121__main__20"/>
dark
sky
and added to the melancholy
<lb n="c56-0121__main__21"/>
impression I received from the objects
<lb n="c56-0121__main__22"/>
around
me —
Alas!
<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22355__Start"/>who can boast<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22355__End"/>
why
<lb n="c56-0121__main__23"/>
does man boast of sensibilities
above <lb n="c56-0121__main__24"/>
those apparent in the
brute
it only
<lb n="c56-0121__main__25"/>
renders them more necessary beings.
Hunger <lb n="c56-0121__main__26"/>& desire and
If our impulses were
<lb n="c56-0121__main__27"/>
confined to
hunger thirst
and
desire <lb n="c56-0121__main__28"/>
we might be
<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22382__Start"/>more<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22382__End"/>nearly free
but now
<lb n="c56-0121__main__29"/>
we are moved by every wind that
<lb n="c56-0121__main__30"/> blows
&
by every <del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22393__Start"/>sc<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22393__End"/>
chance
<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22396__Start"/>work<del loc="c56-0121__main__d1e22396__End"/>
word or<lb n="c56-0122__main__1"/> scene that that
wind
may convey to
<lb n="c56-0122__main__2"/>
us<milestone spanTo="#c56-0122.01" unit="tei:lg"/><lb n="c56-0122__main__3"/>
We
rest,
A dream has power to poison
<lb n="c56-0122__main__4"/><metamark>L</metamark> sleep
<lb n="c56-0122__main__5"/> We
rise
one
wandering
thought pollutes
<lb n="c56-0122__main__6"/>
the
day
<lb n="c56-0122__main__7"/> We
feel
conceive, or
reason –
laugh
or
weep
<lb n="c56-0122__main__8"/> Embrace fond
woe
or cast our cares
<lb n="c56-0122__main__9"/>
away<milestone spanTo="#c56-0122.02" unit="tei:lg"/><lb n="c56-0122__main__10"/>
It is the
same –for
be it joy or
sorrow
<lb n="c56-0122__main__11"/> The path of its departure still is
free
<lb n="c56-0122__main__12"/>
Mans
yesterday may
ne'er
be like <lb n="c56-0122__main__13"/>his
morrow
<lb n="c56-0122__main__14"/> Nought may endure but
mutability.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0122__main__15"/>
It was
noon when I arrived at the
<lb n="c56-0122__main__16"/>
top of the
<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22460__Start"/>mountain<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22460__End"/>ascent.
For some time I
<lb n="c56-0122__main__17"/>
sat upon
the
<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22469__Start"/>the<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22469__End"/> rock that overlooks
<lb n="c56-0122__main__18"/>
the sea of ice. A mist covered both
<lb n="c56-0122__main__19"/>
that and the surrounding
untains <lb n="c56-0122__main__20"/>
Presently a breeze dissipated the
mist <lb n="c56-0122__main__21"/>
and I descended
on
the
<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22486__Start"/>ice<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22486__End"/>glacier. It is in<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22498__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22498__End"/>tersper<lb n="c56-0122__main__22"/>sed with rifts –
The surface is very
uneven <lb n="c56-0122__main__23"/>
rising like the waves of a troubled sea,
<lb n="c56-0122__main__24"/> decending <del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22512__Start"/>tow<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22512__End"/>
low, &
interspered
by rifts
<lb n="c56-0122__main__25"/>
that sink
deep—
The
<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22525__Start"/>width of the<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22525__End"/>field
of<lb n="c56-0122__main__26"/> ice is
<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22534__Start"/>nearly<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22534__End"/>
a
<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22538__Start"/>lege<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22538__End"/> league,<metamark>^</metamark>in
width, but I
was <lb n="c56-0122__main__27"/>
nearly two hours in crossing
it – Theoppo<lb n="c56-0122__main__28"/>site<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22563__Start"/>t<del loc="c56-0122__main__d1e22563__End"/>
mountain is a bare perpendicu<lb n="c56-0122__main__29"/>lar
rock.–From that
side where I now
<lb n="c56-0122__main__30"/>
stood Montanvert was exactly
opposite <lb n="c56-0122__main__31"/>
at the distance of a
league
and above<lb n="c56-0123__main__1"/>
I should listen to the dæmon – my <lb n="c56-0123__main__2"/> feelings were against it but the <lb n="c56-0123__main__3"/> misery he expressed had al<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22592__Start"/>l<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22592__End"/>ready <lb n="c56-0123__main__4"/> moved my compassion and I thought <lb n="c56-0123__main__5"/> the least justice I could shew would <lb n="c56-0123__main__6"/> be to listen to to his tale.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0123__main__7"/> We entered the hut – the monster <lb n="c56-0123__main__8"/> lighted a fire and sitting by it he <lb n="c56-0123__main__9"/> began thus.<lb n="c56-0123__main__10"/>
it rose Mont
Blanc
in awful majesty. I re<lb n="c56-0123__main__11"/>mained in a recess of the
rock
gazing on
<lb n="c56-0123__main__12"/>
this wonderful &
stupedous scene – <lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__1"/>
the
sea
or
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__2"/>
rather the vast river of
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__3"/>
ice, wound among
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__4"/><del loc="c56-0123__left_margin__d1e22642__Start"/>the<del loc="c56-0123__left_margin__d1e22642__End"/>
its
dependant <lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__5"/> mountains
whose
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__6"/>
aerial
summits
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__7"/>
hung over its
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__8"/>
recesses.
Thier <lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__9"/>
icy & glittering
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__10"/>
peaks shone
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__11"/>
in
sunlight
<lb n="c56-0123__left_margin__12"/>
over the clouds. My
heart <lb n="c56-0123__main__13"/> before<metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22673__Start"/>sad<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22673__End"/>which
was
sorrowful, now swelled with
somthing
like
<lb n="c56-0123__main__14"/> joy <del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22683__Start"/>I clas<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22683__End"/>
I
exclaimed – Wandering
spirits,
<lb n="c56-0123__main__15"/>
if indeed ye
wander
and do not rest in
<lb n="c56-0123__main__16"/>
your narrow beds, allow me this faint
<lb n="c56-0123__main__17"/> happiness
or take
me
as your
compa<lb n="c56-0123__main__18"/>nion
away from the joys of
life." As
I
<lb n="c56-0123__main__19"/>
said
this
I suddenly beheld
<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22703__Start"/>human<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22703__End"/>the<lb n="c56-0123__main__20"/>
figure of a
man
at some
distance
advancing
<lb n="c56-0123__main__21"/>
towards me with superhuman
speed— <lb n="c56-0123__main__22"/>
He bounded over the crevices in the
<lb n="c56-0123__main__23"/> ice
among which I had walked with
caution, <lb n="c56-0123__main__24"/>
his
stature
also
as he
approached seem <lb n="c56-0123__main__25"/> ed
to exceed that of
man –I
was
<lb n="c56-0123__main__26"/> troubled —
a mist
covered
my
eyes
and
<lb n="c56-0123__main__27"/>
I felt
<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22739__Start"/>ready to pa faint<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22739__End"/>faintness seize me. –
The cold
breeze <lb n="c56-0123__main__28"/>
of the
mountains quickly restored me. <lb n="c56-0123__main__29"/><del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22749__Start"/>But<del loc="c56-0123__main__d1e22749__End"/>
I
perceived
as the shape came
nearer<lb n="c56-0124__main__1"/>
(<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22766__Start"/>oh<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22766__End"/> sight
tremendous and
abhorred)
that it
<lb n="c56-0124__main__2"/>
was the wretch whom I
had <del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22771__Start"/>cr<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22771__End"/> created and <lb n="c56-0124__main__3"/> who
had
caused me such deep misery.
I
<lb n="c56-0124__main__4"/>
trembled with rage
<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22783__Start"/>an<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22783__End"/>
and
horror <del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22786__Start"/>determin<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22786__End"/>I<lb n="c56-0124__main__5"/><del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22793__Start"/>ing<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22793__End"/>resolved<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22802__Start"/>g<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22802__End"/>
to wait his
approach&
then close
<lb n="c56-0124__main__6"/>
with him in mortal combat. He ap<lb n="c56-0124__main__7"/>proached;
I <del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22815__Start"/>saw again that form from which<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22815__End"/><lb n="c56-0124__main__8"/><del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22819__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22819__End"/>
His countenance bespoke bitter
anguish <lb n="c56-0124__main__9"/>
combined with disdain and
malignancy. <lb n="c56-0124__main__10"/>
But I
<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22836__Start"/>hardly<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22836__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>scarcely
observed
this–anger
and hatred
<lb n="c56-0124__main__11"/><del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22848__Start"/>at f<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22848__End"/>
had at first deprived me of
utterance <lb n="c56-0124__main__12"/>
and I recovered only to overwhelm him
<lb n="c56-0124__main__13"/>
with
<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22856__Start"/>express<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22856__End"/>
words expressive of
utter <lb n="c56-0124__main__14"/>
detestation
<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22861__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22861__End"/><del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22864__Start"/>re<del loc="c56-0124__main__d1e22864__End"/>
and
contempt – "Devil" <lb n="c56-0124__main__15"/>
I
exclaimed – "do
you dare approach
me <lb n="c56-0124__main__16"/>
and do not

before it descends to
<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e23994__Start"/>its lowest<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e23994__End"/><lb n="c56-0129__main__2"/>
hide itself behind
<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24001__Start"/>thes<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24001__End"/>yon mountains
and
<lb n="c56-0129__main__3"/> illuminates
another
world
you will have
<lb n="c56-0129__main__4"/>
heard my
story
and can decide.
<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24019__Start"/>And<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24019__End"/><lb n="c56-0129__main__5"/>
on you it
rests
whether I quit for ever
<lb n="c56-0129__main__6"/>
the
habitations
of
man
& lead a
<lb n="c56-0129__main__7"/>
harmless
life
or become the scourge
<lb n="c56-0129__main__8"/>
of your
fellow creatures,<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24034__Start"/>–<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24034__End"/>&
the author of your own speedy
ruin.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0129__main__9"/> As
he said
this
he led the way
<lb n="c56-0129__main__10"/>
across the
ice –I followed –
my heart was
<lb n="c56-0129__main__11"/> full
and I did not answer
him but <lb n="c56-0129__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24056__Start"/>when<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24056__End"/><lb n="c56-0129__left_margin__1"/>as
I
proceeded
I weighed the various arguments
<lb n="c56-0129__main__13"/> which
he had used,
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24073__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24073__End"/><del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24076__Start"/>felt enclined<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24076__End"/>& I
determined at <lb n="c56-0129__main__14"/><lb n="c56-0129__left_margin__1"/>least to listen to his
tale—I
was partly urged
<lb n="c56-0129__main__15"/>
by curiosity, and compassion confirmed
<lb n="c56-0129__main__16"/> me.– <del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24095__Start"/>As<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24095__End"/><del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24098__Start"/>I was not<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24098__End"/>
I had hitherto suppos<lb n="c56-0129__main__17"/>ed him to be the murderer of my
brother <lb n="c56-0129__main__18"/>
and
I wished to find this either confirmed <lb n="c56-0129__main__19"/> or denied<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24119__Start"/>.<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24119__End"/><lb n="c56-0129__left_margin__1"/>
I eagerly sought
<lb n="c56-0129__left_margin__2"/>
a confirma<lb n="c56-0129__left_margin__3"/>tion or denial
<lb n="c56-0129__left_margin__4"/>
of this opinion. For the first
time also
I felt
<lb n="c56-0129__main__20"/>
what the duties of a creator towards his
<lb n="c56-0129__main__21"/>
creature
were
and that I ought to
<lb n="c56-0129__main__22"/>
render him happy before I complained
<lb n="c56-0129__main__23"/>
of his wickedness. these motives urged me
<lb n="c56-0129__main__24"/>
to comply with his
<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24154__Start"/>request<del loc="c56-0129__main__d1e24154__End"/>demand –
We crossed
<lb n="c56-0129__main__25"/>
the
ice
therefore, and ascended the
<lb n="c56-0129__main__26"/>
opposite
rock.–
The air was
cold
and
<lb n="c56-0129__main__27"/>
the rain
began
again
to
descend–We <lb n="c56-0129__main__28"/>
entered the
hut –
the fiend with an
<lb n="c56-0129__main__29"/>
air of
exultation
I with a heavy<lb n="c56-0130__main__1"/>
heart
and depressed
spirits –
But I consented
<lb n="c56-0130__main__2"/>
to
listen and <del loc="c56-0130__main__d1e24183__Start"/>sitting<del loc="c56-0130__main__d1e24183__End"/>seating
myself by the fire which
he <lb n="c56-0130__main__3"/> lighted
he thus
<del loc="c56-0130__main__d1e24192__Start"/>began<del loc="c56-0130__main__d1e24192__End"/>
began his tale.
